page.title: 09POWER STATION IPSWICH
page.content: The Cliff Quay Power Station is the only station within the Ipswich boundary which has responsibility for generating electricity.However, from 1985 this function will cease.Within three years it is planned to demolish the major buildings and to sell the land for other industrial use. Actual production of electricity stopped in March 1985. The coal burning station was thirty years old and by odern standards, was not cost effective.It's six turbines could only produce as one turbine in a modern plant. Naturally the quay used to import the coal is now redundant, the large storage areas are already being used for other purposes (e.g. the storage of imported Volvo cars).
